subject: Writing
title: Obscenity on Trial
description: Learn Obscenity on Trial in one minute.

hook.text: A U.S. judge read an entire novel in court and declared: this book is not obscene. That novel was Ulysses.

buildup.text: James Joyce's Ulysses was banned in the U.S. from 1921 to 1933 for its frank depiction of sexuality.

discovery.text: Judge John Woolsey ruled the book was art, not pornography â€” setting a landmark precedent for literary freedom.

twist.text: The obscenity standard keeps shifting â€” Lady Chatterley's Lover was banned for decades, then taught in colleges.

climax.text: What one era calls obscene, the next calls a classic. The line between art and offense is always moving.

punchline.text: Today's banned book is tomorrow's required reading.

quiz.question: Which judge ruled that Ulysses was not obscene?
